**COURSE DESCRIPTION**

This course aims to prepare students to use English in business settings and to discuss selective business-related topics. Relevant terminologies and patterns will be introduced and practiced in each class meeting. Students are expected to use four skills to participate in a variety of in-class activities, including the discussion and role-play. In the end of this course, students will be asked to work on a group proposal with clear and persuasive language.

**REQUIREMENTS & RULES**

1.  When you write to the instructor, please ALWAYS put **00UB9H2 A** (or **English for Business: Monday 6-7**) in the subject line and identify yourself in the email. Anonymous messages WON’T be read.
2.  You are expected to preview before you attend the class meeting. Please be a responsible student.
3.  You will be asked to work in pairs and in groups. Please be a responsible partner.
4.  Attendance is important. Please show up on time. A notification of absence form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統). It is also the students’ own responsibility to catch up with the class after their absence.
5.  Please make sure that you have your Moodle account and check both the course site and your email regularly. Not receiving a notice/an email is NOT an excuse for absence or late submission.

**Presentation**: **What does a \_\_\_\_\_\_ do?** **(4 people in one group)**

Purpose: To introduce/know a job that (1) you were originally unfamiliar with and (2) particularly requires good language competence (such as human resources officers, brand managers, and social media editors)

1.  Study about the job, including the requirements, responsibilities, skills, advantages and disadvantages, and employment notices.
2.  Present the information about the job with slides (even videos and movie clips).
3.  Answer questions from your classmates.
4.  Prepare a **quiz** (5 multiple questions) for your classmates.
5.  Discuss with the instructor at least ONE WEEK before your presentation.

**Movie Reviews****: Individual or pair, audio/video**

Clips from movies, sit-coms, TED-talks, and news clips are fine.

1.  pick a business-themed movie/sit-com/news report on an issue/discovery
2.  introduce and summarize this movie to your classmates
3.  note three useful expressions you learn from the movies
4.  upload your audio/video to MOODLE

1.  Each student needs to watch/listen to 2 videos and leave comments.

**final group proposal:** **We can do better** **(4 people in one group).**

Purpose: To propose and evaluate a project

Preparation

1.  Study about an advertisement (a poster, a video clip, or in any form).
2.  Evaluate it with all kind of information you can find. For example, the language is not persuasive enough. Certain groups of potential consumers are neglected, discriminated. The promotion strategy conflicts with what you know about consumer behavior.
3.  Come up with a proposal to show you have a better, revised idea.

Final Presentation

1.  Show and evaluate the advertisement (tell us how it could be better).
2.  Make your proposal (tell us how your advertisement is better).
3.  Answer questions from the classmates and the instructor.

After your final Presentation

Each group needs to turn in a ONE page reflection, including every group member’s contribution to this project.
